answers.answer: Hi.  To be able to calculate your prognosis (survival and recurrence rates), I would need some additional information.  How old are you? What's your general state of health? Do you have any chronic illnesses like diabetes or heart disease?  Did the doctors also do estrogen receptor (ER), progeterone receptor (PR), and HER-2 assays on your tumor? If they did, what were the results?  What chemotherapy drugs were given to you?From the information you have posted, your cancer seems to be at Stage IIIA, since your primary tumor is 8 cm in size and there is already spread to 9 nodes.  Treatment for this stage of the disease will consist of radiation therapy to the mastectomy site, in addition to the surgery and chemotherapy which you have undergone.  If your tumor is hormone receptor positive (that is, the ER or PR assays are positive), you would also benefit from at least a five-year treatment with tamoxifen or other hormonal therapy.Patients with stage IIIA, if untreated, have approximately a 60% chance of survival in 10 years, and a 60% chance of recurrence in 10 years.  These statistics improve depending on the kind of treatment given.  I can give you a more accurate approximation of your prognosis if you can post the additional information I requested. Thanks.
